update.description:
Add the solar panel model and a plugin which deploys the panel when its button is pressed.

![sp3.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/2798895465-sp3.png)

![sp1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3683688321-sp1.png)

* The total mass of the panel has been set to 5 kg. It would be nice to randomize this within a range. Maybe from 4 to 6 kg?

* 80% of the mass is on the base, so the panel tends to fall in the vertical and is more stable after deployed.

![sp4.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/2752603032-sp4.png)

![sp2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/1787119936-sp2.png)

* I left the collisions as trimeshes, but we might need to revisit this and use simple shapes instead. It will be hard to match all the little details which are good for grasping though.

* The button needs to be in contact with something while it's pressed to be triggered.

* The plugin can be toggled on and off through gazebo topic `/task2/checkpoint3/toggle`. This is used by `Task2CP3`

* The solar panel is integrated into the world generator, but its pose will change, since we need to place it inside the rover.



### How to try it

1. `unique.world` now includes the solar panel, so you can launch it:

    `roslaunch srcsim unique.launch init:=true`

1. Wait for `INIT: Done`

1. Skip to the solar panel checkpoint. Since there are no other checkpoints before it on Task2 yet, you can do:

    `rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 2 1`

1. You'll see a message:

        [Msg] Task [1] - Skipped (26 584000000)
        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [1] - Started (26 584000000)
        success: True 
        [Msg] Started solar panel plugin

1. You can try moving the panel around and it shouldn't open.

1. Throw something onto the button and it will open.

1. You'll see a message like:

        [Msg] Solar panel is open
        [Msg] Stopped solar panel plugin
        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [1] - Completed (38 795000000)
        [Msg] Task [2] - Checkpoint [2] - Started (38 795000000)
        [Msg] Started box contains plugin [task2/checkpoint6]

### Example

Here's an example video:

https://youtu.be/FLFzsrpJm_k
update.title: Solar panel model and plugin

content.raw: Let's stick with nonzero max vel and 1.5 mm of min depth for now.
content.html: Let's stick with nonzero max vel and 1.5 mm of min depth for now.

content.raw: @rmerriam , you can see some previews on pull request #38 and pull request #41
content.html: @rmerriam , you can see some previews on pull request #38 and pull request #41

content.raw:
I updated the contact parameters on the solar panel and the rover to the values you had given me for the table on pull request #37, which are:

~~~
        <surface>
          <contact>
            <ode>
              <kp>1e5</kp>
              <kd>1</kd>
              <max_vel>0.1</max_vel>
              <min_depth>0.0015</min_depth>
            </ode>
          </contact>
        </surface>
~~~

On another branch where I'm integrating all the models (`rover_and_solar_panel`), I put the panel on top of the rover and the contacts between them are not stable with these parameters.

Actually, I had been previously using the following parameters, and they result in more stable contacts:

~~~
        <surface>
          <contact>
            <ode>
              <max_vel>0.0</max_vel>
              <min_depth>0.01</min_depth>
            </ode>
          </contact>
        </surface>
~~~

Thoughts?
content.html:
I updated the contact parameters on the solar panel and the rover to the values you had given me for the table on pull request #37, which are:

        <surface>
          <contact>
            <ode>
              <kp>1e5</kp>
              <kd>1</kd>
              <max_vel>0.1</max_vel>
              <min_depth>0.0015</min_depth>
            </ode>
          </contact>
        </surface>

On another branch where I'm integrating all the models (rover_and_solar_panel), I put the panel on top of the rover and the contacts between them are not stable with these parameters.

Actually, I had been previously using the following parameters, and they result in more stable contacts:

        <surface>
          <contact>
            <ode>
              <max_vel>0.0</max_vel>
              <min_depth>0.01</min_depth>
            </ode>
          </contact>
        </surface>

Thoughts?

content.raw: Also on the generated world: b4e4fd5
content.html: Also on the generated world: b4e4fd5

![sp1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3683688321-sp1.png)

* The total mass of the panel has been set to 5 kg. It would be nice to randomize this within a range. Maybe from 4 to 6 kg?

* 80% of the mass is on the base, so the panel tends to fall in the vertical and is more stable after deployed.

![sp4.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/2752603032-sp4.png)

![sp2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/1787119936-sp2.png)

* I left the collisions as trimeshes, but we might need to revisit this and use simple shapes instead. It will be hard to match all the little details which are good for grasping though.

* The button needs to be in contact with something while it's pressed to be triggered.

1. Wait for `INIT: Done`

1. Skip to the solar panel checkpoint. Since there are no other checkpoints before it on Task2 yet, you can do:

1. You'll see a message:

content.raw: The panel will be on top of a higher surface, more pull requests are coming.
content.html: The panel will be on top of a higher surface, more pull requests are coming.

content.raw: Is R5 going to be able to bend over or squat to attach the cable to this panel if it is on the walkway? Also will the head be able to tip enough to see the plug?
content.html: Is R5 going to be able to bend over or squat to attach the cable to this panel if it is on the walkway? Also will the head be able to tip enough to see the plug?
